Key Match Events: Cristian Javier struggled in an abbreviated postseason start, allowing three runs and four hits in the first inning.
Houston Astros never took off in Game 7, going 2 for 14 with runners in scoring position.
Post-Match Reflections: Houston manager Dusty Baker expressed disappointment about the loss, but emphasized the team's success over the past four years.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Houston went 39-42 at Minute Maid Park during the regular season, but it secured the AL West title with a win at Arizona and a Texas loss on the final day.
Others: No team with a losing record at home has ever reached the World Series.
The Astros are the only big league team to lose four home games in a seven-game postseason series.
